course.subject: ECON
course.name: Topics in Monetary Economics
course.description: The course covers fundamental issues in monetary economics: essentiality of money, neutrality/nonneutrality of money, optimal monetary policy, money (as an asset) v.s. higher-return assets, money (as a means for inter-temporal allocation) v.s. credits, outside money v.s. inside money, money and banking, etc. Rigorous modelling is emphasized. Independent research project is expected.
course.prerequisites: ECON 5250 AND ECON 5260
